Which steps occur when establishing a TCP connection between two computers using sockets?

options.a: The server instantiates a ServerSocket object, denoting which port number communication is to occur on
options.b: The server invokes the accept() method of the ServerSocket class. This method waits until a client connects to the server on the given port
options.c: After the server is waiting, a client instantiates a Socket object, specifying the server name and port number to connect to

options.a: JIT improves the runtime performance of computer programs based on bytecode.
options.b: JIT is an application development framework.
options.c: JIT is an implementation of the Java Virtual Machine which executes Java programs.

options.a: class variables are static variables within a class but outside any method.
options.b: class variables are variables defined inside methods, constructors or blocks.
